senses.de: To happen or occur again and again
senses.ex: These issues recur frequently in his work.

Tips.title: Frequent Events
Tips.description: Use 'recur' to describe events that happen often over a period of time.

Tips.title: Negative Situations
Tips.description: Often used to describe undesirable events or problems that keep coming up.
Tips.example: The software bug recurred despite the fixes.

Tips.title: Avoid 'Again'
Tips.description: 'Recur' already implies repetition, so avoid saying 'recur again' as it is redundant.

senses.ex: The thought kept recurring to him.

Tips.title: Mental Return
Tips.description: Use 'recur' when a thought or feeling keeps coming back to your mind.
Tips.example: The memory of that day kept recurring to her.

Tips.title: Involuntary Nature
Tips.description: The return of thoughts or memories is often out of one's control, implied by 'recur'.
Tips.example: Despite trying to forget, the melody recurred in his mind.

Tips.title: Unsettling Feelings
Tips.description: Can suggest the persistence of unwanted thoughts or dreams that trouble someone.
Tips.example: The nightmare recurred, leaving her unsettled each morning.

senses.de: To return to a previous part or form
senses.ex: We recur to the postulation of an ultimate creator.

Tips.title: Historical Reference
Tips.description: 'Recur' can be used when discussing returning to past traditions or practices.
Tips.example: The community decided to recur to its ancestral customs.

Tips.title: Back to Origins
Tips.description: Can indicate going back to the original state or to the beginnings of something.
Tips.example: The debate recurrently recurred to the founding principles.

Appear.wordDefinition:
Appear means to show up or become visible for the first time, while the word recur means to happen or appear again, often repeatedly.

Appear is applicable in situations when something is happening for the first time, and recur is applicable when something is happening repeatedly or happening again.

For example, if a new student joins a school, they will appear in the classroom for the first time, but if a student gets sick often during the school year, their illness will recur.

Come back.wordDefinition:
The words come back mean to return to a place or situation that you were in before. It's used for situations where you physically return to a place or resume an action or behavior that you've previously engaged in.

Come back is used for a physical return to something, while recur is used for something that happens repeatedly, even if it's not a physical object or action.

Recurrence.wordDefinition:
Recurrence refers to the act of something happening again or the fact of something occurring repeatedly. For example, if there is a recurrence of a disease, it means the disease has come back or happened again.

Recur is the action or the verb while recurrence is the name or noun of what's happening.

Repeat.wordDefinition:
Recur means to occur again, repeatedly or periodically. It usually refers to events or situations that happen again and again in a regular pattern.

Repeat means to do or say something again, or to replicate an action, word or event.

This word refers to a singular action that is done again. For example, washing the dishes after dinner, reciting a sentence to memorize it or playing a song that one has already played before can all be classified as repeating.

Recur refers to things that happen again and again at regular intervals, while repeat refers to doing or saying something once again.

Return.wordDefinition:
Return means to come back to a place or to give back something that was borrowed or taken.

For example, "I will return home after the party." "Please return the book to the library."

Recur is used when something keeps happening again and again, while return is used when we come back to a place or give something back to its original owner.

quotes.Text: I was always prepared for my 'Fringe' journey to end immediately. I had only signed up for a guest role but they kept bringing me back in the third season as a recurring character. So pretty much every time I went to film a 'Fringe' episode I kind of said goodbye to the show, but then they kept bringing me back.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Seth Gabel

quotes.Text: I recurred on 'Grey's Anatomy' for three years, and at the same time, I recurred for eight episodes on 'Rescue Me'. And I'd recurred for nine episodes on 'The Practice'. Frankly, the guest star is often the most compelling character.
quotes.Title: Welsh Actress
quotes.Name: Kate Burton

quotes.Text: As a child, I used to have a secret dread - and a recurring nightmare - of the whole world becoming city, being covered with cement and buildings and streets. No more country. No more woods.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: W. S. Merwin

quotes.Text: I used to have a recurring black-and-white dream where I would drive in on a hover car and raid the shoe closets of this huge mansion. I don't know what that means at all, to be honest.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Barbie Ferreira

quotes.Text: I tend to describe recurring themes as being part of a writer's DNA - something so deeply embedded in us that even we don't notice it until we've written three or four books.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Sara Zarr

quotes.Text: Fashion takes its inspiration from society and everyday life, which is the same for everyone, and this is perhaps the reason why certain elements recur.
quotes.Title: Italian Designer
quotes.Name: Stefano Gabbana

quotes.Text: It's a recurring thing: It's that I fall really deeply for bad relationships. It's just always been this way and not changing.
quotes.Title: German Musician
quotes.Name: Kim Petras

quotes.Text: It's much easier to come back as a recurring character. Because you already know his traits and who he is and what he's about.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actor
quotes.Name: Adam Beach

quotes.Text: I have a recurring nightmare that I wake up in a gutter with nothing. I've had it all my life. That's why I work, I think.
quotes.Title: British Designer
quotes.Name: Kevin McCloud

quotes.Text: American exceptionalism is the recurring character in the nation's narrative.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Ron Fournier
